title: Graded Assertiveness
content: Assertiveness can escalate: inquiry, advocacy, assertion, emergency intervention. Start by asking questions ('Are you aware that...?'). If unaddressed, state your concern directly. If still ignored and safety is at risk, take action. The gradient provides options while maintaining the ability to stop unsafe acts.

mcq.question: You've stated a concern twice and been dismissed. The situation is worsening. What's next?

options.A: Accept their judgmentâ€”they have more authority
options.B: Escalate to stronger assertion or direct intervention
options.C: Document your concern and step back
options.D: Wait for someone else to intervene

mcq.explanation: Authority doesn't override safety. If graduated assertiveness hasn't worked and risk is escalating, stronger intervention is required. 'I need you to stop. This is unsafe.' Document later.

openQuestions: Have you ever had to escalate beyond initial assertiveness?
What would make you physically intervene in an unsafe situation?
